alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 551 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Ranchvale to 6 miles northwest of Crossroads. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Ranchvale, Arch, Oasis State Park and Cannon Air Force Base. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 378 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
